result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:35 AM Defendant COREY A TUCKER in court with attorney Nelida Cortes.  Defendant COREY A TUCKER in custody.  Parties appear via Zoom.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Off. S. Kohn sworn & testifies. Cross - exam.  Re-direct.  Arguments. Court finds State has met burden, finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial.  

BOND MOTION:
Atty Cortes - DE is eligible for treatment, bed is waiting and available on April 6.  ADA Kaupie - DE has prior missed appearances, argues against signature bond. 
Court - $1000 cash, $9000 signature bond w/conditions: DE to go from jail to Rhinelander (transportation through SHSO or Human Services only) , Proof of check-in provided to Court, Must provide monthly updates, if DE leaves treatment facility he MUST report IMMEDIATELY to Shawano Co. jail, Upon release DE must check-in with Court.  Failure to comply, previous bond will be imposed.  DE addresses the Court.
Arraignment scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

08:19 AM Defendant COREY A TUCKER in court with attorney Nelida Cortes.  Defendant COREY A TUCKER in custody.  Parties appear via Zoom.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Cortez - not sufficient facts relating to DE, argues pg 5 of State's response.  Objection by State to reference to JI - Party to a crime.  ADA Kaupie - Defendant's arguments to be used at trial, not Preliminary Hearing.  Believes 4 corners of complaint provide sufficent cause.  Atty Cortes argues.  
Court- finds believes there is enough in the 4 corners.  Items were within reach of DE.  Motion is DENIED.
